A flat lay of the book I Was Here by Gale Forman. The cover has colorful pieces of torn paper against a light purple background. Next to it is a cup with a single scoop of ice cream.

Review: I Was Here by @gayleforman 
Rating ğŸ¶ğŸ¶ğŸ¶ğŸ¾ (3.5/5) 
Trigger warning: this book and this review contains topics of suicide 
ğŸ“š
Honestly, I went into this expecting to be disappointed. Itâ€™s not often that fictional media depicts suicide in its reality, as in, doesnâ€™t romanticise it (eg looking for Alaska, 13 reasons why looking at u). However, this book focused a lot less on the death, and a lot more on the aftermath. The grief was written well - especially the anger. Itâ€™s so often anger in grief is ignored, when itâ€™s a natural part of the grief process. Codyâ€™s grief felt angry, sad, devastating, vulnerable, even if it was made a little poetic at times. I felt like this story captured well the aftermath of loss and grief. At no point did I think Megs death was made â€˜beautifully tragicâ€™ or any of those other BS things we often see in fictional suicide stories. 
ğŸ“š
I thought the romance story line was a little unnecessary - however it was actually such a small part of the story I let it slide (even if I still rolled my eyes a little bit).
ğŸ“š
Overall, I enjoyed this read, however itâ€™s not for everyone. Iâ€™m not sure if I feel as though the actual storyline was realistic, but the emotions behind it were. What I appreciated most is the authors note (swipe to see) where they put in an educated effort to break the stigma of suicide. 
ğŸ“š
This was my first YA read in a while - I really noticed the difference in writing style. While I think I do enjoy a bit more mature writing style, it was refreshing to read something written a little differently and revisit my teenage inner dialogue. 
ğŸ“š

I was here | Eu estive aqui
Author: @gayleforman
Editor: @editorial_presenca
4.5â­/5 | 9/10

âš ï¸TWâš ï¸{depressÃ£o; suicÃ­dio; luto}

ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§Review in English in the comments.

ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¹Sinopse
Cody fica chocada e arrasada com o suicÃ­dio de Meg, a sua melhor amiga. A pedido dos pais desta, Cody viaja atÃ© Tacoma, onde a amiga estudava, para reunir os seus pertences. Espantada, Cody descobre que Meg nunca lhe falara de inÃºmeros aspetos da sua vida. Por exemplo, os novos amigos, que sÃ£o o tipo de pessoas com quem Meg nunca se daria antes de entrar para a faculdade, ou Ben, o vocalista de uma banda por quem a jovem se apaixonara. PorÃ©m, a sua maior descoberta ocorre quando acede ao computador de Meg e de repente tudo o que pensava que sabia sobre a morte da amiga se desmorona. Cody decide entÃ£o levar esta descoberta Ã s Ãºltimas consequÃªncias.

ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¹Review
Este Ã© o primeiro e Ãºnico livro que li desta autora (por agora ğŸ™ƒ). Tenho a dizer, desde jÃ¡, que a escrita da autora Ã© muitÃ­ssimo cativante, nÃ£o Ã© chata, nem nos vemos perdidos no meio da histÃ³ria. Ã‰ verdade que Ã© uma histÃ³ria mais teen do que aquilo que eu costumo gostar, em termos de vocabulÃ¡rio e comportamentos das personagens. 
Mas, ainda assim, os temas tratados no livro sÃ£o tÃ£o importantes, e, por vezes, tÃ£o menosprezados na nossa sociedade que me levou a dar a pontuaÃ§Ã£o que dei a este livro. Eu dou muita importÃ¢ncia a temas como a depressÃ£o e o suicÃ­dio, porque quando alguÃ©m pede ajuda, por se encontrar nesse estado, muitas vezes os outros minimizam a situaÃ§Ã£o, tratam o assunto como se fosse uma dramatizaÃ§Ã£o. E nÃ£o Ã© para ser lidado dessa forma. Ã‰ preciso reconhecer e ajudar, se gostamos mesmos dos outros. E Ã© um assunto que deve ser falado e deve deixar de ser tratado como um tabu. Por essa mesma razÃ£o, gostei muito deste livro, pela forma como a Cody, a personagem que perdeu a amiga [Meg], passou por todo o processo de luto, lidou com a perda de alguÃ©m que amava tanto.
Gostei, tambÃ©m, imenso da forma como vamos conhecendo a Meg ao longo do tempo, apesar de ser uma personagem que jÃ¡ nÃ£o se encontra fÃ­sicamente lÃ¡, Ã©-nos dada a hipÃ³tese de conhecer coisas que nem a melhor amiga sabia. 
~Continua nos comentÃ¡rios

'I was here' was an easy read. It's ironic to say so as it covers most of the darkest emotions but is actually written in a pleasant manner that it doesn't suffocate the reader's with an ache-y heart.

It tells the tale of two inseparable best friends, one of which decides to end her life (TW: suicide) leaving her friend Cody (the protagonist), tangled in the net of a zillion questions, doubts, grief, guilt, pain and agony (to name a few) aand the bumpy road to acceptance of this irreplaceable loss.

The author Gayle Forman has mainly focused on the aftermath of suicide. From the other side. From those who are left behind. Parent's, siblings, friend's, any loved one's.. what they have to go through, to deal with. Occasionally giving real insightful messages and lessons penned down in a beautiful manner.
Although, I did feel that Cody's emotions could've been explored some more in depth and detail.. but as this book is aimed towards young adults, it was sufficient. The love and romance is also very predictable (but that's just me maybe, I predict everything while watching movies tooğŸ˜) but I enjoyed it nonetheless. 

Overall, this book is a nice and pleasant work of fiction, with a little thrill towards the end. You'd surely like to highlight some sentences and quotes though, to stick with you for a lifetime. 

Rating: 4/5

Â¿Son de hacer relecturas?, Â¿cuÃ¡ndo deciden releer un libro?, Â¿tiene algÃºn criterio para hacerlo?â €
â €
Si no cuento los libros que releo para exÃ¡menes de la facultad, la lista de relecturas que hice no es sumamente larga. Muchas veces me cuesta sentarme a releer un libro porque tengo tantas cosas que quiero y tengo que leer que se me va la vida. Por ahora, los afortunados fueron: Persona normal de Taibo; AquÃ­ dentro siempre llueve de Pueyo; Heima es hogar en islandÃ©s de Soler; El dÃ­a que dejÃ³ de nevar en Alaska de Keller; Red, white and royal blue de McQuistonâ €
â €
Ãšltimamente tengo ganas de revisar/revisitar ciertos libros que se encuentran en el principio de mi vida lectora. En mi caso, creo que esta necesidad se debe no solo a reencontrarme con mi yo lectora de 12 aÃ±os, sino tambiÃ©n ver y experimentar cÃ³mo una dÃ©cada de vida lectora y unos cuantos aÃ±os de formaciÃ³n en Letras cambian o afectan mi visiÃ³n sobre estos libros. Tengo la intenciÃ³n de ir releyendo e ir contÃ¡ndoles cuÃ¡l fue mi experiencia con estos libros.â €
â €
Muero de ganas de releer la saga que devorÃ© cuando era chica, Percy Jackson. Los libros del tÃ­o Rick fueron un camino de ida y la puerta de acceso a la mitologÃ­a. Sus libros son la forma en que alimento a mi niÃ±a interior.â €
â €
Algo muy similar me ocurriÃ³ con Los juegos del hambre y la explosiÃ³n del gÃ©nero distÃ³pico en la literatura juvenil junto con la heroÃ­na femenina. Creo que Collins nos llevÃ³ a muchos a adentrarnos en este gÃ©nero que tanto tiene para darnos y del que tantas reflexiones podemos extraer. â €
â €
Otro es la bilogÃ­a Just one day de Gayle Forman, la autora de Si decido quedarme. Pero su mejor libro es I was here. Tal vez en un tiempo pueda volver a recomendarlo, ahora no sÃ© si era muy bueno o si me recordÃ³ mucho a una experiencia propia. â €
â €
Siguiendo la lÃ­nea de romance no puedo dejar de mencionar Los dÃ­as que nos separan de Laia Soler. Libro magnÃ­fico que amÃ© profundamente cuando lo leÃ­ por primera vez. â €
â €
Dejar para el final a Austen fue, completamente, intencional. Orgullo y prejuicio fue mi primer clÃ¡sico, lleguÃ© a Ã©l gracias a que la pelÃ­cula y me enamorÃ³. Tengo la necesidad de releerlo en su idioma original junto con PersuasiÃ³n

What would you do if you've lost the person you think knows you the most? What if you found out that she decided to take her own life? And what if it turns out that you don't exactly know her like you thought you did? 
I Was Here by @gayleforman is the kind of book which give you goosebumps whenever you turn the pages to find out what will happen next. 
Despite being a book about depression, suicide and friendship, this book actually taught me that sometimes we should keep in mind that we could never actually know someone more than we know ourselves. 
I Was Here revolves around Cody's investigation on what and who made her kill herself or why did she? Soon, Cody would find out reasons for her decisions and would eventually know what had really been happening with Meg before she even thought of taking her own life. ğŸ‘¤
